document_data.name: Faldast
document_data.mainbody:
'''Faldast''' was a warrior in the [[Frostfire Banner]] adventuring party in the mid–8{{th}} century [[DR]].
{{quote|"Don't say such foolhead things, Arvas," one of his companions growled. "They sound all too much like the sort of cues ambushing brigands like to follow. That sentence of yours sounds like something that should end with an arrow taking you in the throat...or the chunk of road your charger's standing on rising up to be revealed as the head of some awakened titan or other."|The warrior Faldast of the [[Frostfire Banner]] in the {{yearlinkName|767}}}}
document_data.Description: His voice wasn't as deep as that of his comrade [[Paeregur]].
document_data.History:
Faldast was a member of the Frostfire Banner when they took on High Duke [[Horostos]]'s assignment to search for the reason why all animals larger than one's hand, as well as most people, were vanishing on the road between [[Starmantle]] and [[Ripplestones]].

They were ambushed on their first night out of Starmantle by a chiming mist, [[Saeraede Lyonora|the Slayer]]. Paeregur, by the time he was able to check up on them, found only two survivors, none of which were Faldast.
